content.body: You used to call fetch, get back an intermediate response, and then call HTTP-redirect fetch with that intermediate response
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: You used to call fetch, get back an intermediate response, and then call HTTP-redirect fetch with that intermediate response

content.body: Now fetch does not return a response, but HTTP-redirect fetch still expects one
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Now fetch does not return a response, but HTTP-redirect fetch still expects one

content.body: So you'd have to do something like having your processResponse (which gets the intermediate response!) call HTTP-redirect fetch

content.body: Right now HTML's strategy is to call navigate-redirect fetch and it's a no-op if we've reached the end. Then we look at the location URL. And only call navigate-redirect fetch if it's not null or failure.
